intro: Seseli ugoense, commonly known as the Ugoense Seseli, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is noted for its delicate white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
